title: CLOs Wrap Up Record Year
summary: Bundles of low-rated corporate loans have been one of 2021's top-performing debt investments. Investors' search for higher yields and Wall Street's shift to a new interest-rate benchmark powered a record year in sales of collateralized loan obligations-securities made of bundles of low-rated corporate loans.

title: Desmond Tutu Is Laid to Rest in South African State Funeral
summary: Mourners pay tribute to the man seen as South Africa's moral compass in a service limited to 100 because of Covid-19 regulations. CAPE TOWN, South Africa-The funeral began at 10 a.m. under a thick blanket of cloud and drizzle, as black-clad mourners filed into the cathedral and past the simple wooden casket of Archbishop Desmond Tutu. One by one, speakers climbed the pulpit at St. George's, where the diminutive cleric spent decades preaching against the racial injustice of South Africa's apartheid government. By midday, as the choir concluded with "Behold Our Great High Priest," sunlight had burned through the fog, glinting through stained-glass windows and revealing this city's iconic Table Mountain.

title: Russia-Ukraine Conflict Lies in the Bones of an 11th-Century Prince
summary: Resume Subscription. In the 11th century, a prince called Yaroslav the Wise united principalities lying between the Baltic and Black seas, codifying laws and forming the first political state of the eastern Slavs. Both Russia and Ukraine claim him as a forefather.

title: The 1984 Car So Rare Only BMW Diehards Know About It
summary: Resume Subscription. Monty King, 69, a retired special-projects coordinator with R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Co. living in Winston-Salem, N.C., on his 1984 BMW E30 Alpina C1 2.3, as told to A.J. Baime.

title: Pricey Chicken Puts Thighs on Restaurant Menus
summary: Restaurants are finding ways to incorporate the less-popular dark meat amid short supplies of breasts and wings. Short supplies and escalating costs of chicken breasts and wings are leading restaurants to add thighs and other dark poultry meat to menus and entrees.

title: Puerto Rico's Retirement-Plan Woes Persist as Bankruptcy Nears End
summary: A proposed restructuring would end defined-benefit retirement programs for active teachers and judges. Puerto Rico's long history of failing to pay its pension obligations is expected to haunt the U.S. territory even after its bankruptcy ends.

title: Headaches and Backlogs Loom as Tax Filing Season Nears Again
summary: Mid-April deadline returns as IRS tries to whittle down piles of paperwork. WASHINGTON-The third tax-filing season during the coronavirus pandemic is set to begin soon with more delays, uncertainty and frustration likely for taxpayers and tax preparers.

title: Scotland Moves to Pardon Thousands Executed as Witches-400 Years Later
summary: Resume Subscription. NORTH BERWICK, Scotland-The wind blew hard one fall night here in 1589. So much so that King James VI concluded that witches must have gathered in this fishing town to conjure up the storm that delayed the arrival of his new bride, the sister of the Danish king.

title: A New Perspective on the Dutch Masters
summary: The newly revamped galleries of Dutch and Flemish Art at the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, display old favorites and new acquisitions to maximum effect..

title: U.S. on Sidelines as China and Other Nations Launch Trade Pact
summary: The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership will eventually eliminate more than 90% of tariffs on commerce among 15 member countries. WASHINGTON-China joins U.S. allies including Japan and Australia in a new Asia-Pacific trade agreement that launches Saturday-with the U.S. watching from the sidelines.

title: 10 Fitness Hacks for New Year's Resolution Success
summary: Set meaningful goals to achieve bigger-picture fitness resolutions. As The Wall Street Journal's What's Your Workout columnist, I have started many a New Year vowing to exercise more and eat healthier. And just like 80% of people who make New Year's resolutions, I have often dropped them before Super Bowl Sunday.

title: Catholic Dioceses Investigate Their Role in Boarding Schools for Native Americans
summary: Inquiries include searching for evidence of students who might have died at the institutions. Catholic dioceses across the U.S. are beginning to investigate their role in operating boarding schools for Native American children in the late 1800s and 1900s, including searching for evidence of students who might have died at the institutions.

title: Red-Hot Housing Market Fuels Mortgage Borrowing Record
summary: Lenders issued an estimated $1.61 trillion in purchase mortgages in 2021. Americans borrowed more than ever to buy homes in 2021.

title: New Covid-19 Pills Carry Risks: What Patients Should Know
summary: Pfizer's antiviral treatment can interact with other drugs, and Merck's isn't recommended for pregnant women. The first Covid-19 antiviral pills that can be taken at home are a new treatment option for infected people, but they carry safety warnings and limitations that could complicate treatment decisions for patients, doctors and pharmacists.

title: U.S. Companies Are Thriving Despite, or Because of, Covid-19
summary: Revenues, profit margins have surpassed late-2019 levels for most public companies; bigger firms have fared better than smaller ones.

title: This New Year, Resolve to Take a WSJ Challenge
summary: Sign up for one of our email challenges to start your year. In the past few years, The Wall Street Journal launched a trio of email challenges to help our readers get better at something in their lives, from exercise to money. Each challenge starts when you sign up, and continues with one email a week to your inbox-full of exercises and how-tos-for six weeks.

title: Kim Jong Un Largely Ignores U.S., South Korea in Year-End Speech
summary: North Korean leader makes no reference to the U.S. and mentions inter-Korean relations just once in party speech. SEOUL-North Korean leader Kim Jong Un vowed to pursue high-tech weapons to counter what he called military instability on the Korean Peninsula, but largely ignored the U.S. and South Korea in a year-end speech.

title: It's Alabama vs. Georgia for the National Title After a Pair of Blowouts
summary: The Crimson Tide defeated Cincinnati 27-6 to return to the title game, where they'll face a Bulldogs team that beat Michigan 34-11. MIAMI GARDENS, Fla.-Georgia played football with all the subtlety of a wrecking ball throughout the 2021 season-with the exception of one Saturday in December, when Alabama matter-of-factly shut down the Bulldogs' destructive ways and ruined their perfect season.

title: Gold Notches Largest Percentage Decline Since 2015
summary: Investors expect rising interest rates and a climbing U.S. dollar to pressure the metal. Inflation shot higher in 2021. Gold didn't.

title: Crypto Burrows Into the Mainstream
summary: It was another crazy year in the crypto world, but traders didn't seem to mind. Millions of new investors decided to try their hand at cryptocurrencies in 2021.. Crypto has been many things in its short history. 2021 was the year it became part of the mainstream.

title: New Year's Eve Is Muted Once Again by Covid-19
summary: Public health experts urge caution as people gather to ring in 2022. After the somber welcome that greeted 2021, many people saw this year's holiday season as a time to revel in a return to near-normal. But New Year's Eve celebrations around the world have once again been canceled or scaled back amid a new wave of Covid-19 infections driven by the Omicron variant.

title: Beijing Fell Short on Trade Deal Promises, Creating Dilemma for Biden
summary: China missed targets for buying U.S. goods, but retaliating could come at a cost to American companies and consumers. WASHINGTON-Beijing's commitment to step up purchases of U.S. goods and services under a 2020 trade pact expires Friday with China expected to miss its targets by a wide margin, creating a dilemma for the Biden administration as it calibrates a response.

title: Ringing in 2022 Around the Globe
summary: People ushered in the new year with fireworks and festivities all over the world. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.
